title: Pharaoh's sceptre

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Pharaoh's sceptre is a staff found during the Pyramid Plunder minigame in Sophanem, from the golden chests and sarcophagi. It requires 30 Attack and 30 Magic to wield.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Pharaoh's sceptre
This article is about the Pyramid Plunder minigame reward. For the Stronghold of Security reward, see Skull sceptre.

The Pharaoh's sceptre is a staff found during the Pyramid Plunder minigame in Sophanem, from the golden chests and sarcophagi. It requires 30 Attack and 30 Magic to wield.

The sceptre starts with three charges. It can be recharged higher depending on the player's progress in the Desert Diary, but is only tradeable on the Grand Exchange while it has three charges or is uncharged.

Combat styles[edit | edit source]

Teleportation options[edit | edit source]

A player using the Pharaoh's sceptre teleport.
Destination Map
Jalsavrah, inside the starting room of Pyramid Plunder
Jaleustrophos, outside the Agility Pyramid
Jaldraocht, inside Azzanadra's pyramid

The teleport function of the sceptre works up to level 30 in the Wilderness.

Recharging[edit | edit source]

To recharge the sceptre, the player must talk to the guardian mummy inside the Pyramid Plunder pyramid. It must be out of charges before it can be recharged. The mummy will complain about the player owning the sceptre but will recharge it anyway. The player must give the mummy either 6 gold artefacts, 12 stone artefacts, or 24 pottery/ivory artefacts. Different shaped artefacts may be combined as long as they are all the same material, and noted artefacts are accepted along with un-noted ones. It is recommended that when a player has used all but one of the sceptre's charges, the last charge should be used to teleport to Pyramid Plunder for this reason.

By default, the sceptre is recharged to three charges. Players who have progressed in the Desert Diary have their sceptre recharged with more charges; up to 4 with the easy diary, 5 with the medium diary, 6 with the hard diary, and 8 with the elite diary.

The following table shows recharge costs according to Grand Exchange prices.

Type Ivory/Pottery Stone Gold
Comb/Seal 24 x = 5,088 12 x = 2,748 6 x = 4,878
Scarab 24 x = 2,472 12 x = 2,352 6 x = 6,036
Statuette 24 x = 2,448 12 x = 2,412 6 x = 7,524

This table below compares the value of artefacts when sold to Simon Templeton. This may be useful for ironmen when comparing which artefacts to save for charges. As a general rule, you almost always get more value out of selling the gold artefacts.

Type Ivory/Pottery Stone Gold
Comb/Seal 24 x = 1,200 12 x = 1,800 6 x = 4,500
Scarab 24 x = 1,800 12 x = 2,100 6 x = 6,000
Statuette 24 x = 2,400 12 x = 2,400 6 x = 7,500

Obtaining[edit | edit source]

Pharaoh's sceptres are rarely received from the golden chests and sarcophagi during the Pyramid Plunder minigame. The chance of receiving a Pharaoh's sceptre scales depending on the floor level, upon a successful theft from a grand gold chest or sarcophagus (meaning no scarabs or mummies appear). After a player finds a sceptre, they will immediately be kicked from the pyramid by the guardian mummy. If the player had no free inventory space when they found the sceptre, it will appear on the ground under them when they are outside the pyramid; if this occurs, players only have about 30 seconds to pick it up.

Room Rate Cumulative rate [n 1]
Room 1 1/3,500 1/3,500
Room 2 1/2,250 1/1,370
Room 3 1/1,250 1/654
Room 4 1/750 1/349
Room 5 1/650 1/227
Room 6 1/650 1/168
Room 7 1/650 1/134
Room 8 1/650 1/111
  1. ↑ This cumulative rate shows the rate of getting the sceptre in a run where you loot every golden chest you encounter up to and including on that floor, while ignoring the sarcophagi

Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

Tier Emotes STASH Location Items Cost
Master Yawn 7th room in Pyramid Plunder 4,126,539
  • The Pharaoh's sceptre can have any amount of charges. The pieces of the menaphite clothing must all be the same colour, both the kilt and robe can be used. It's possible to store the menaphite clothing in the STASH unit without the Pharaoh's sceptre.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
16 March 2022
(update | poll)

Pharaoh's Sceptre is now 1-handed.

24 March 2021
(update)

Pharaoh's Sceptre now has scaling drop rates depending on the room its chest/sarcophagus is located.

23 September 2020
(update)
  • The "Jalsavrah" and "Wield" options were switched, so Wield is now first.
  • "Jalsavrah" was made the first option when equipped.
31 August 2017
(update)

Partially charged versions of the item could now be turned into bank placeholders.

22 June 2017
(update)

When leaving Pyramid Plunder with a full inventory, rewarded pharaoh's sceptres will remain on the ground for longer than 30 seconds.

9 February 2017
(update)

The uncharged version was made darker to distinguish it from charged versions.

11 February 2016
(update)

The "Teleport" left-click option was replaced with a "Jalsavrah" left-click option, and "Jaleustrophos", and "Jaldraocht" right-click options.

20 August 2015
(update)

Fixed typos in teleport messages given by the Pharaoh's Sceptre.

16 April 2015
(update)

Murky Matt will only decant Pharoah's sceptres with the amount of charges you have unlocked from the desert diary.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

The Pharaoh's sceptre now holds more charges for the completion of Desert Diaries:

  • 4 total charges for the easy diary.
  • 5 total charges for the medium diary.
  • 6 total charges for the hard diary.
  • 8 total charges for the elite diary.
26 June 2014
(update | poll)

The Pharaoh's sceptre now has an alch value of 50,000 coins.

6 March 2014
(update | poll)

Charged versions were renamed from "Pharaoh's sceptre" to "Pharaoh's sceptre (n)".

25 April 2013
(update)

The jewelled sceptre no longer teleports players into the Desert Treasure pyramid before they have completed enough of the quest to unlock it.

4 – 29 January 2007

The item was renamed from "Pharoah's sceptre"[sic] to "Pharaoh's sceptre".

present

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • If the player talks to Simon Templeton while holding a sceptre, he will try to convince them that it is worthless and will offer 100 coins for it, which the player refuses.
  • When someone else in the pyramid finds a sceptre, an annoyed guardian mummy appears in some rooms next to the golden chest noting that someone has stolen it.
  • It was commonly used by lurers due to the sceptre having a teleport as its left click option. Scammers get the player to go on a pvp world and "wield" the sceptre, knowing this which teleports the player into a player vs player zone, leading to the player losing their items.

detail.png|left|150x150px]] |version8 = [[File:Pharaoh's sceptre detail.png|left|150x150px]] |version9 = [[File:Pharaoh's sceptre detail.png|left|150x150px]] }} The '''Pharaoh's sceptre''' is a [[staves|staff]] found during the [[Pyramid Plunder]] [[minigame]] in [[Sophanem]], from the golden chests and sarcophagi. It requires 30 [[Attack]] and 30 [[Magic]] to wield. The sceptre starts with three charges. It can be recharged higher depending on the player's progress in the [[Desert Diary]], but is only tradeable on the [[Grand Exchange]] while it has three charges or is uncharged. {{Infobox Bonuses |version1 = Uncharged |version2 = (1) |version3 = (2) |version4 = (3) |version5 = (4) |version6 = (5) |version7 = (6) |version8 = (7) |version9 = (8) |astab = +7 |aslash = -1 |acrush = +25 |amagic = +10 |arange = +0 |dstab = +2 |dslash = +3 |dcrush = +1 |dmagic = +10 |drange = +0 |str = +32 |rstr = 0 |mdmg = 0 |prayer = 0 |slot = weapon |speed = 4 |attackrange = 1 |combatstyle = Polestaff |image = [[File:Pharaoh's sceptre equipped.png|170px]] |altimage = [[File:Pharaoh's sceptre equipped female.png|150px]] }} ==Combat styles== {{CombatStyles|Polestaff}} ==Teleportation options== [[File:Pharaoh's sceptre teleport.gif|thumb|200px|A player using the Pharaoh's sceptre teleport.]] {{TeleportLocationTableHead}} {{TeleportLocationLine|name='''Jalsavrah''', inside the starting room of [[Pyramid Plunder]]|x=1934|y=4428|plane=3|mapID=10129|mtype=pin}} {{TeleportLocationLine|name='''Jaleustrophos''', outside the [[Agility Pyramid]]|x=3341|y=2827|plane=0|mtype=pin}} {{TeleportLocationLine|name='''Jaldraocht''', inside [[Jaldraocht|Azzanadra's pyramid]]|x=3232|y=2897|plane=0|mtype=pin}} {{TableBottom}} The teleport function of the sceptre works up to level 30 in the [[Wilderness]]. ==Recharging== To recharge the sceptre, the player must talk to the [[guardian mummy]] inside the Pyramid Plunder pyramid. It must be out of charges before it can be recharged. The mummy will complain about the player owning the sceptre but will recharge it anyway. The player must give the mummy either 6 gold artefacts, 12 stone artefacts, or 24 pottery/ivory artefacts. Different shaped artefacts may be combined as long as they are all the same material, and noted artefacts are accepted along with un-noted ones. It is recommended that when a player has used all but one of the sceptre's charges, the last charge should be used to teleport to [[Pyramid Plunder]] for this reason. By default, the sceptre is recharged to three charges. Players who have progressed in the [[Desert Diary]] have their sceptre recharged with more charges; up to 4 with the easy diary, 5 with the medium diary, 6 with the hard diary, and 8 with the elite diary. The following table shows recharge costs according to Grand Exchange prices. {| class="wikitable" !Type!!Ivory/Pottery!!Stone!!Gold |- |Comb/Seal |24 x {{plinkp|Ivory comb}} = {{Coins|{{GEP|Ivory comb}} * 24}} |12 x {{plinkp|Stone seal}} = {{Coins|{{GEP|Stone seal}} * 12}} |6 x {{plinkp|Gold seal}} = {{Coins|{{GEP|Gold seal}} * 6}} |- |Scarab |24 x {{plinkp|Pottery scarab}} = {{Coins|{{GEP|Pottery scarab}} * 24}} |12 x {{plinkp|Stone scarab}} = {{Coins|{{GEP|Stone scarab}} * 12}} |6 x {{plinkp|Golden scarab}} = {{Coins|{{GEP|Golden scarab}} * 6}} |- |Statuette |24 x {{plinkp|Pottery statuette}} = {{Coins|{{GEP|Pottery statuette}} * 24}} |12 x {{plinkp|Stone statuette}} = {{Coins|{{GEP|Stone statuette}} * 12}} |6 x {{plinkp|Golden statuette}} = {{Coins|{{GEP|Golden statuette}} * 6}} |} This table below compares the value of artefacts when sold to [[Simon Templeton]]. This may be useful for ironmen when comparing which artefacts to save for charges. As a general rule, you almost always get more value out of selling the gold artefacts. {| class="wikitable" !Type!!Ivory/Pottery!!Stone!!Gold |- |Comb/Seal |24 x {{plinkp|Ivory comb}} = {{Coins|50 * 24}} |12 x {{plinkp|Stone seal}} = {{Coins|150 * 12}} |6 x {{plinkp|Gold seal}} = {{Coins|750 * 6}} |- |Scarab |24 x {{plinkp|Pottery scarab}} = {{Coins|75 * 24}} |12 x {{plinkp|Stone scarab}} = {{Coins|175 * 12}} |6 x {{plinkp|Golden scarab}} = {{Coins|1000 * 6}} |- |Statuette |24 x {{plinkp|Pottery statuette}} = {{Coins|100 * 24}} |12 x {{plinkp|Stone statuette}} = {{Coins|200 * 12}} |6 x {{plinkp|Golden statuette}} = {{Coins|1250 * 6}} |} ==Obtaining== Pharaoh's sceptres are rarely received from the golden chests and sarcophagi during the [[Pyramid Plunder]] minigame. The chance of receiving a Pharaoh's sceptre scales depending on the floor level, upon a successful theft from a grand gold chest or sarcophagus (meaning no [[Scarab swarm|scarabs]] or [[mummy|mummies]] appear). After a player finds a sceptre, they will immediately be kicked from the pyramid by the guardian mummy. If the player had no free inventory space when they found the sceptre, it will appear on the ground under them when they are outside the pyramid; if this occurs, players only have about 30 seconds to pick it up. {| class="wikitable" ! Room !! Rate ! Cumulative rate This cumulative rate shows the rate of getting the sceptre in a run where you loot every golden chest you encounter up to and including on that floor, while ignoring the sarcophagi |- | Room 1 | 1/3,500 | 1/3,500 |- | Room 2 | 1/2,250 | 1/1,370 |- | Room 3 | 1/1,250 | 1/654 |- | Room 4 | 1/750 | 1/349 |- | Room 5 | 1/650 | 1/227 |- | Room 6 | 1/650 | 1/168 |- | Room 7 | 1/650 | 1/134 |- | Room 8 | 1/650 | 1/111 |} ==Treasure Trails== {{EmoteClueHeader}} {{EmoteClue|tier=master|emote=Yawn|location=7th room in [[Pyramid Plunder]]|item1=pharaoh's sceptre|item2=menaphite purple hat|item3=menaphite purple top|item4=menaphite purple kilt|cost2={{min|{{GEP|menaphite purple hat}}+{{GEP|menaphite purple top}}+{{GEP|menaphite purple kilt}}|{{GEP|menaphite purple hat}}+{{GEP|menaphite purple top}}+{{GEP|menaphite purple robe}}|{{GEP|menaphite red hat}}+{{GEP|menaphite red top}}+{{GEP|menaphite red kilt}}|{{GEP|menaphite red hat}}+{{GEP|menaphite red top}}+{{GEP|menaphite red robe}}}}}} {{EmoteClueBottom}} *The Pharaoh's sceptre can have any amount of charges. The pieces of the menaphite clothing must all be the same colour, both the kilt and robe can be used. It's possible to store the menaphite clothing in the STASH unit without the Pharaoh's sceptre. ==Products== {{Uses material list|Pharaoh's sceptre}} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject 9 February 2017 |9 February 2017 –
present |} ==Trivia== *If the player talks to [[Simon Templeton]] while holding a sceptre, he will try to convince them that it is worthless and will offer 100 coins for it, which the player refuses. *When someone else in the pyramid finds a sceptre, an annoyed guardian mummy appears in some rooms next to the golden chest noting that someone has stolen it. *It was commonly used by lurers due to the sceptre having a teleport as its left click option. Scammers get the player to go on a pvp world and "wield" the sceptre, knowing this which teleports the player into a player vs player zone, leading to the player losing their items. {{Pyramid Plunder}} {{Magic weapons}} {{Teleportation items}}
